attributes.action: Make south west water improve the water treatment plant in Looe Cornwall
attributes.background: Looe in south east Cornwall has been taken over by the stench of the sewage works, especially west Looe. The odours are repugnant and is putting off holidaymakers. We also lose tourist because sewage is allowed to overflow in heavy rains affecting both the estuary and the water quality on the beach.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay Â£104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act (2010) to include all gender identities and expressions
attributes.background: The Equality Act (2010) made important strides when it included making it unlawful to discriminate against transsexuals. However this excludes all other gender identities that fall under the Transgender umbrella, therefore taking away their freedom to be themselves for fear of persecution.

attributes.action: Improve access to NHS dental services in Cornwall and Devon
attributes.background: According to Cornwall's NHS Dental Helpline, there is a six- to 12-month wait just to get on an NHS dentist's books in Cornwall. In late 2015 there were 7,500 people on the waiting list. We desperately need better access to NHS treatment as few people can afford private dental fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.piratefm.co.uk/news/latest-news/1834169/7500-wait-for-a-dentist-in-cornwall/

attributes.action: Create a 'silent shopping hour' for autistic people in supermarket chains.
attributes.background: Autism Spectrum Condition is a developmental disorder that affects 700,000 people in the UK from birth. One type of autism is is over/under sensitivity to senses such as hearing, sight and smell. As a result, many autistic people find it very difficult to shop with lots of noise and flashing lights.
attributes.additional_details: An ASDA branch in Manchester ran a trial of a 'quiet hour' for autistic people, in which they turned off bright lights, loud music, and store announcements. This was very highly supported, and autistic people found it incredibly beneficial for them. We are a National Citizen Service group who have learned a lot about this topic recently, and we want more supermarket branches to create a 'silent hour', in order to make life that little bit easier for people with autism.

attributes.action: Bring back sibling enrolment at schools.
attributes.background: The government need to rethink the enrolment of children into schools. They have lost a common sense approach and as of this year are forcing parents to accept their ridiculous decisions on school placements.
attributes.additional_details:
As of now if you have at least one child in a primary school and you apply for the September start for a younger sibling, the government can now ignore common sense and force you to be at 2 different schools at exactly the same time.
They need to bring get back the old "sibling" question into the application for a school place so parents are not put through so much mental stress facing the prospect of having to be on opposite sides of a town at the same time.

attributes.action: Mandate our EU representatives veto further EU expansion instead of Brexit
attributes.background: Much of the leave campaign support seemed to surround the potential for Turkey and other countries joining the EU. Rather than leaving the EU, we should mandate that we use our power of veto to ensure that this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details: I have watched countless TV programmes interviewing the supporters and voters of the leave  campaign. This appears to be the main issue, with many saying that the migrants that are here should be allowed to stay. By mandating our power of veto, this would facilitate the UK staying in the EU, with the benefits it brings and stop the EU from expanding by increasing the member countries.

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.

attributes.action: Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service check
attributes.background:
It is not compulsory for Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Previously known as a CRB check.

From the age of 16 you are eligible for Compulsive Basic Training (on a scooter) which means you can have 1:1 tuition from an approved Motorcycle Instructor.
attributes.additional_details:
A teaching profession which involves contact with young people should have DBS check as a mandatory requirement to safeguard the general public.  NHS workers, teachers and approved driving instructors (ADI) all have a DBS check.

The Driving Standards and Vehicles Agency uses the loose term of 'Fit and Proper' to approve a Motorcycle Instructor. Those individuals who have a previous criminal record, or spent time in prison, can still become or continue their role as Motorcycle Instructor.

attributes.action: Make Blue Badges Available to People With Mental Health Conditions.
attributes.background:
Under current regulations mental health conditions such as agoraphobia, anxiety and panic disorder are not accepted as valid reasons for needing a Blue Badge.
These conditions can be equally and sometimes more debilitating than a physical disability and it is discriminatory to exclude them.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badges, which allow people with certain disabilities to park closer to services, are only available to those with a physical disability. Those suffering from the above conditions are not able to apply for a badge unless they receive the higher rate of the mobility component of DLA.
The exception is if a person is unable to follow a familiar route without aid.
Mental health conditions can affect mobility and be extremely disabling, preventing a full life. Blue Badges could help with this.

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: UK Cities who voted "Remain" to be granted freedom to leave the UK & join the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum should never have happened.  The UK is a REPRESENTATIVE democracy ie we select and pay politicians to do the business of Government for us.  A decision so momentous should not have been handed to an electorate unqualified to comprehend the magnitude of the task.
attributes.additional_details:
The Referendum was about economics & trade. The media & certain politicians made it about blaming hard-working immigrants.

The EU Referendum was not supported by the educated or the young.  It was not supported by the cities.

London has a bigger GDP than many states. My city, Norwich, has thriving links with Europe as does Cambridge.  

We in the cities who voted to Remain in the EU see no alternative but to petition to be allowed to leave a country determined to commit economic suicide.

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: Set up a Commission of Enquiry into the Bromley Housing Transfer of 1993
attributes.background: In 1993 Bromley Borough council tenants were given the unenviable task of choosing between a cash-strapped, cost-cutting council and privatisation of the entire housing stock, apparently for all time. This seems a peculiarly heavy democratic burden for any electorate to bear, especially the poor.

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the Â£40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: End all UK weapons sales to oppressive regimes.
attributes.background: The UK currently sells large quantities of weapons to countries that the Foreign Office recognises as having poor human rights records, including some that have even been accused of war crimes. Profit and political pandering to these regimes should not outweigh basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.amnesty.org.uk/yemen-conflict-uk-must-stop-selling-arms-saudi-arabia

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/britain-still-arming-israel-despite-fear-weapons-will-be-used-against-gaza-10357621.html

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/28/uk-weapons-sold-countries-poor-human-rights-saudi-arabia?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/08/killer-facts-the-scale-of-the-global-arms-trade/

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers add a braille description of contents on food packaging.
attributes.background: This is a reasonable adjustment that will cost very little and aid people to have further independence.

attributes.action: Ethical consumption rating to be displayed alongside price for all products
attributes.background:
Our current consumption culture focuses on price. The true cost of buying that product is rarely reflected in the price.

The introduction of an ethical consumption traffic light system at brand level will enable conscientious consumers to easily make informed decisions about what they buy.
attributes.additional_details:
An ethical rating should be founded on the following core principles:
 -Environmental impact
 -People (wages, working conditions, exploitation of employees)
 -Animals (animal testing, welfare of animals)
 -Political activity
 -Product Sustainability (Organic, Fairtrade, Positive Environmental Features)

attributes.action: Make 23 April "NHS appreciation day"
attributes.background: 1 and 17 March, and 30 November are bank holidays in Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland. There is no such holiday on 23 April in England. This date should be nominated as appreciation day of a Great British and Northern Irish institution to unite all who benefit from this service around the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS makes me proud to be a citizen of the UK. As I sit here and write this from my baby son's bedside on a children's ward, I am moved to tears by the care he is receiving tonight from highly trained and caring professionals who have left their own family behind to care for mine. What is most amazing is that this is free at the point of use for all. Why not dedicate a day per year for the appreciation of the NHS and its staff.

attributes.action: Removal of discourteous remarks/misdiagnosis from medical records
attributes.background: Too many deaths or extended suffering caused by erroneous comments in medical records. There is also too much focus on psychology as a cop-out diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details:
When the patient is later found to have a serious physical illness, the error and misdiagnosis remains in the medical records, along with any discourteous remarks. 
The patient is not empowered and can't get the entry  removed, only blocked.

attributes.action: Stop any UK aircraft from intercepting Russian aircraft in Syria.
attributes.background: To prevent any escalation between Russia and the United States, and Britain's involvement in a future large scale war in Syria leading to a global conflict.  We request that Her Majesty's Government order a stand down of all R.A.F planes from firing upon Russian planes.

attributes.action: Make Healthy start vouchers available to all low income families
attributes.background: Poverty does not only exist in non-working families. The ability to access fruit, vegetables and milk is essential but not always possible for low income families that work. Healthy growth and development should be of paramount importance for this government, allowing the working poor to thrive.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if we can make this change we will reap the benefits as a nation within a small amount of time. We will see the general health of families on low incomes improving meaning less strain on our hospitals and doctors surgeries. People less likely to eat sweets and high sugar foods so will see an improvement in oral health the wider implications are endless.

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay Â£220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the Â£220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: Introduce medical intervention sooner for those suffering with Anorexia Nervosa
attributes.background: Medical intervention should begin sooner to prevent a patients rapid deterioration of health. Counselling as a first form of treatment is not at all useful on its own if the patient is suffering malnourishment. Their brain lacks ability to concentrate and withhold useful advice and information.
attributes.additional_details: Medical and counselling services should work hand in hand to ensure fast diagnosis and early intervention. Medical help to prevent extreme rapid deterioration of an individual health is vital. Much to the individuals refusal and disapproval this should be pressed or encouraged to help the recovery process begin as soon as possible. Putting off recovery will only prolong the suffering and tormenting thoughts, allowing them to become the only way in life like a 'voice' that must be abided by.

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, Â£4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. Â£7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Remove the words European Union from British passports.
attributes.background: As the country has voted to leave the European Union, we believe that the words European Union should be removed from British passports. Furthermore, we believe that the original black passports should be reinstated as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Stop legally classifying pets as property.
attributes.background: Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling by businesses to mobile and home phones
attributes.background: Cold calling has always been a problem but recently it is becoming a real nusense with companies ringing personal mobile/home phones at all times of day and night sometimes multiple times within a day to either sell products, force PPI claims or tell you you've been in an accident when you haven't.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies should not be able to obtain and call your personal phone often with wrong or assumptive information and of a repetitive nature, with some companies calling multiple times in the same week despite being told you are not interested which is harassment and against human rights.

I am petitioning to ban cold calling from businesses to home and mobile phones as to protect people from being harassed in their personal time as it can be very distressing in particular for vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to fly the Union Flag on all public buildings.
attributes.background: The UK appears to have a most disgraceful fear of displaying our national flag on public buildings, on the grounds of either some misplaced sense of danger under health & safety legislation or for fear of offending some minority group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is one of the only countries in the world where the flying of the national flag is actively discouraged by local councils and governmental bodies. This is a national & international disgrace.

The UK has decided that it no longer wishes to be politically associated with our European neighbours, rather to display our independence. Yet we are actively discouraged from showing our national flag as a symbol of that very independence.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Change in Immigration rules due to the immigration solicitors negligence
attributes.background: Our application  for leave to remain was simply rejected because our Immigration solicitor showed negligence in our application, after spending 11 years in UK we are now on verge to be removed from UK, I request everyone to sign this petition and bring change in immigration rules
attributes.additional_details:
We want Secretary of State to consider Solicitor's negligence as an exceptional circumstances.

For Example Law includes below as exceptional circumstances currently :
o travel or postal delays. 
or beyond control situation for applicant.
For example:
o The Home Office has lost or delayed returning travel documents.
o The applicant is having problems replacing lost documents as a result of theft, fire or
flood. 

but Point requested to be included in Law is as below:
o Your previous solicitor's showed negligence in your case and you have evidance from legal ombudsman to prove solicitors negligence.

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: Make the Punishment fit the Crime
attributes.background: Today the Victim does Not get Justice in Many cases, Causing Death by say Dangerous Driving when they get their sentence Cut in Half and winds up around Two years per Life makes life Cheap, they should be Banned for say Ten years and Ten years per life taken, they will not learn by a slap on hand.
attributes.additional_details:
More sentences are stupid when handed out, Victims Must see Justice done for their Loss, many Stupid Boy Racers who should never be on the road for others Safety.

They also Must pass their Test again.

Also this Applies to All other Deaths by whatever means.

Let's Stop Silly Sentences being handed out from the Courts, bet they would not like it for one of their family Members.

attributes.action: Trident to be removed from Scotland and renewed in England
attributes.background: Trident is not welcome in Scotland and rejected by Scottish MPs, if English MPs vote for the renewal of WMD then it should be done in England and not Scotland where it is heavily opposed.

attributes.action: A General Election or another EU Referendum
attributes.background: Considering the very misleading campaign to leave the EU, the fallout we have witnessed since the now obviously flawed results and the fact that nobody in power seems to be acknowledging these issues, we the undersigned demand that the fixed term rules of Parliament be put aside and call an election
attributes.additional_details: If Parliament are not willing to allow a general election at this volatile and very confusing time, then at least pay attention to the facts surrounding the EU Referendum, that the results were largely due to flawed campaigns, lies and manipulations.  Many people, an estimated 7% according to one survey would vote differently 'now they know' the facts.  A referendum should not be actioned on results garnered through false information and scare tactics.  Election, or another referendum is needed.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of Economics at GCSE level.
attributes.background: Teaching Politics does not help voters make an informed decision on matters such as the EU Referendum, as it is largely an economical matter. It gives us little insight to the implications of our decisions. Economics gives children factual knowledge to allow them to form decisions on such matters.
attributes.additional_details:
The effect a decision will have on the economy is central to any debate or issue. To make an informed decision, people require knowledge (e.g how free markets work) and the effect their vote will have on the economy. Knowledge of Economics allows students to make educated and substantial choices.

By teaching Economics, this is providing students skills for adult life, a major issue with schools as they fail to teach students skills useful in adult life such as budgeting, taxes and employment.

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.
